paragraphs.text: In one of his blog posts from 2015, he just changed the title and the copy, which doesn’t influence the date.

f0a1f50940ae.title: You wouldn’t believe how difficult it is for visual artists.

paragraphs.text: You wouldn’t believe how difficult it is for visual artists. Few businesses will even pay for images anymore when they can be so easily stolen on the Internet. Furthermore, magazines and publishers won’t pay artists for their work when they publish. Everyone is supposed to be excited about the “free exposure” and somehow use that to pay their bills.
paragraphs.name: 6b35

f3006c181d7c.title: I do believe a lot of people might share articles, forward them or retweet/republish and simply don…

paragraphs.text: I do believe a lot of people might share articles, forward them or retweet/republish and simply don’t know how to (or that they should) credit the original author. Or they don’t know who the original author is. They may even suppose you were posting an article you found too. A lot of uncles and moms on Facebook are prone to that.
paragraphs.name: af25

virtuals.subtitle: But it’s sad when those who know better reproduce it as their own.

989362d039ea.title: This is absolutely terrible, and I’m glad you stood up for yourself and made some noise.

paragraphs.text: This is absolutely terrible, and I’m glad you stood up for yourself and made some noise. Content creation is difficult and stealing from others is never okay. We already have enough of a hard time proving our importance in our respective industries — the last thing we need is someone stealing our hard work for views and profit.
